decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with a low-cost, aggressive strategy. By utilizing a mix of small, efficient creatures and powerful anthems like "Always Watching," the deck aims to flood the board with threats and quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Declaration in Stone provides removal to deal with opposing threats, while the mana base is streamlined to consistently support the aggressive game plan. This deck is designed to apply consistent pressure and maintain a high tempo throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures that can be cast quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Reflector Mage, the deck aims to control the board while continuously applying pressure through strong creatures like Tireless Tracker and Sylvan Advocate. The inclusion of cards like Nissa, Vastwood Seer and Eldrazi Displacer provide additional value and versatility in both ramping and controlling the opponent's creatures. Overall, the deck's main strategy revolves around quickly deploying threats and maintaining board presence to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with green spells and lands to cast powerful creatures and board wipes, allowing the player to control the game by efficiently managing threats and resources. The key strategy is to deploy threats like Dragonlord Atarka and World Breaker to dominate the battlefield while using Kozilek's Return and Chandra, Flamecaller to deal with opposing creatures and maintain board control. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its powerful late-game threats and efficient removal options.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a wide board presence with efficient creatures and planeswalkers, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with removal spells like Dromoka's Command and Declaration in Stone. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive start, using cards like Hangarback Walker and Archangel Avacyn to apply pressure. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Evolutionary Leap and Oath of Nissa to provide card advantage and consistency. Overall, this deck focuses on proactive plays and efficient threats to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures onto the battlefield and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive attacks. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck can quickly build a board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Reflector Mage. Eldrazi Displacer provides additional utility by flickering creatures for additional value. The key strategy is to continuously apply pressure with efficient creatures and outpace the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Thalia's Lieutenant, Lambholt Pacifist, and Reflector Mage while also utilizing cards like Collected Company to quickly flood the board. Dromoka's Command and Ojutai's Command provide utility and disruption, while Eldrazi Displacer offers versatile removal and tempo plays. The mana base is optimized for consistent early game plays, allowing the deck to apply pressure from the start and maintain tempo throughout the game.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up your mana using green cards like Explosive Vegetation and Nissa's Pilgrimage, allowing you to cast powerful spells like Fall of the Titans and Dragonlord Atarka. Pyromancer's Goggles and Chandra, Flamecaller provide additional value by duplicating your burn spells or creating more tokens. Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger is a powerful finisher, while Traverse the Ulvenwald ensures you have access to the right cards when you need them. Overall, this deck aims to control the game by overwhelming your opponent with big creatures and burn spells.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing a combination of efficient creatures and powerful spells. By building a board presence quickly with cards like Sylvan Advocate and Hangarback Walker, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out games before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Voice of Zendikar and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar further enhances the deck's ability to go wide and maintain pressure on the opponent. Tragic Arrogance and Declaration in Stone provide additional ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan and clear the way for a decisive victory.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to quickly play aggressive and efficient creatures onto the battlefield while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Reflector Mage and Dromoka's Command. Collected Company helps to quickly put multiple threats onto the board, while Thalia's Lieutenant pumps up the team. The inclusion of Eldrazi Displacer allows for additional utility and disruption, providing a versatile way to control the board. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and versatile aggro strategy.

This Golgari aggro deck focuses on generating creature tokens and sacrificing them for value, utilizing effects like Zulaport Cutthroat and Nantuko Husk to drain the opponent's life total. Cryptolith Rite helps ramp up mana for quicker plays, while Collected Company and Duskwatch Recruiter provide card advantage and help dig for key pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flood of creatures, backed up by removal from cards like Silumgar Assassin and Liliana, Heretical Healer. Westvale Abbey can also provide a game-ending threat with Ormendahl, Profane Prince.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by removing threats and countering spells with cards like Ultimate Price, Grasp of Darkness, and Transgress the Mind. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Read the Bones to ensure that it has the resources to outlast the opponent. Finally, the deck has a strong finisher in Dragonlord Silumgar and Goblin Dark-Dwellers to close out the game once it has gained control.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and eventually ramping up to play powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Using cards like Clash of Wills and Spell Shrivel to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also having access to cards like Chandra, Flamecaller and Kozilek's Return for additional board control. The deck also utilizes mana ramp with cards like Hedron Archive and Shrine of the Forsaken Gods to quickly reach the late game and overwhelm the opponent with game-ending threats.

The main concept of this Naya Control deck revolves around utilizing a variety of planeswalkers, creatures, and spells to maintain control of the board through removal, protection, and token generation. By utilizing cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar alongside powerful control spells like Dromoka's Command and Declaration in Stone, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of Archangel Avacyn and other resilient threats adds a layer of protection and versatility to the deck's overall strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. By maximizing damage output and controlling the board with counterspells and removal, the deck aims to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game. Cards like Fevered Visions and Dimensional Infiltrator provide additional ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan and push for victory. With a mix of flying creatures and burn spells, this deck is designed to be fast and efficient in dealing damage and securing the win.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a swarm of small, aggressive white creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant, Always Watching, and Kytheon, Hero of Akros, the deck aims to build up a strong board presence and put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Cards like Declaration in Stone and Consul's Lieutenant provide additional support and removal options to help maintain board dominance. With a low mana curve and efficient creatures, this deck is designed to consistently apply pressure and win through aggressive tactics.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a swarm of low-cost white creatures that benefit from buffs and support cards. The strategy is to establish a strong board presence early in the game and maintain pressure on the opponent by constantly deploying threats. The deck focuses on efficient creatures with abilities that boost each other, as well as removal spells to deal with any opposing threats. By leveraging the synergy between its cards, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.
